books.title: The Hashish Eater
books.author: Fitz Hugh Ludlow
books.summary: A philosophical contemplation of youthful adventures spent ingesting large doses of psychoactive cannabis extract.

books.title: Kidnapped
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After his parents die, a young Scottish man travels to see his only remaining relative, expecting to be welcomed, but instead finds his life and liberty in grave danger.

books.title: Elizabeth and Her German Garden
books.author: Elizabeth von Arnim
books.summary: The English wife of a German aristocrat recounts, through a series of diary entries, a year spent revitalizing the neglected garden of their estate.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: The Swiss Family Robinson
books.author: Johann David Wyss
books.summary: A Swiss family is shipwrecked on a remote island in the East Indies.

books.title: Jeeves Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring Jeeves and Wooster and the upperclass English life of the early 1900s.

books.title: The Taming of the Shrew
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: An unmarriageable shrew receives a marriage proposal.

books.title: Beyond Thirty
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young naval officer finds himself in a forbidden part of the world after storms waylay his ship.

books.title: The Rainbow
books.author: D. H. Lawrence
books.summary: Three generations of an English family struggle to adapt in a society rapidly changed by industrialization.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A tragic scientist creates a monster in his laboratory.

books.title: The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano
books.author: Olaudah Equiano
books.summary: An autobiography of an ex-slave in the mid 1700s.

books.title: His Last Bow
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his faithful biographer tackle more mysterious cases.

books.title: The Everlasting Man
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton takes us through the history of man, rebuking common secular views and presenting the case for the Catholic Church.

books.title: Darkwater
books.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
books.summary: A collection of essays, short fiction, and poetry related to the lives of black people in Jim Crow-era America.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Georgia Douglas Johnson
books.summary: A collection of poems by Georgia Douglas Johnson.

books.title: Vile Bodies
books.author: Evelyn Waugh
books.summary: A young man in Roaring Twenties London endures ups and downs in varied situations and relationships.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frank Belknap Long
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Frank Belknap Long, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Children’s Stories
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A collection of Oscar Wilde’s children’s stories.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.
